Option C - Vestibular nucleus: : The Vestibular nucleus, in the brainstem, processes balance and spatial orientation signals from the vestibular system. It coordinates motor responses but doesn't directly connect to Purkinje cells, though it may have connections with the cerebellum. Option D - Locus coeruleus: : The Locus coeruleus in the brainstem releases norepinephrine, regulating attention, arousal, and stress responses.
